home.introduce1: I am a web frontend developer.
home.introduce2: In my free time, I enjoy searching for delicious food and traveling around.
home.introduce3: Occasionally, I share information about technology and development!
home.introduceDetail1: I am a frontend developer with { year } years of experience and a degree in Computer Science. During my university years, I focused on Android development, but my passion for frontend led me to transition into web frontend development.
home.introduceDetail2: I am committed to becoming a developer who values quality and performance.
home.introduceDetail3: Outside of work, I continuously learn technical knowledge and stay updated on the latest frontend trends.
home.introduceDetail4: I also love traveling and exploring new cuisines. I welcome like-minded enthusiasts to connect and share experiences.
home.contact-text: Here is my contact information if you'd like to get in touch.

20240814.title: Putting Family First: The Decision to Resign and What It Taught Me

jobInfo.workContentGigabyte: Initially responsible for developing and maintaining internal Android apps and Java backend services. Later transitioned to frontend development due to increasing web demand, primarily working on the internal CMS platform using Vue 2. Participated in the redevelopment of the e7line e-commerce website by converting the original .NET site into a frontend-backend separated architecture using Nuxt 2, focusing on SEO optimization.
jobInfo.workContentEnvotions: Assisted in the frontend-backend separation of the main website, and developed activity and sub-websites. Primarily used Nuxt 3 and Vue 3 for development.
jobInfo.workContentOwlting: Collaborated on revamping the PayNow system, working with the backend to build an official website and a frontend-backend separated CMS system. Also assisted in developing payment SDKs.
